ticket.title: Erubis template parsing error on invalid match for variable name containing "do"
ticket.original-body:
Re: Rails 3.0.0.beta3
See add_expr_literal method in Template::Handlers::Erubis. The expression BLOCK_EXPR falsely matches "do" during template compilation for a variable named "todo."
To reproduce, generate a scaffold for an entity named "Todo." The default output for the "Show" link is malformed and generates a syntax error ("unexpected tIVAR, expecting keyword_do or '{' or '('").
BLOCK_EXPR probably just needs word boundaries or whitespace around the "do."
If necessary, this mailing list thread has additional info:
http://groups.google.com/group/rubyonrails-talk/browse_thread/thread/c9861a1f74d6e4cd

BLOCK_EXPR probably just needs word boundaries or whitespace around the "do."

ticket.original-body-html:
Re: Rails 3.0.0.beta3

See add_expr_literal method in Template::Handlers::Erubis. The expression BLOCK_EXPR falsely matches "do" during template compilation for a variable named "todo."

To reproduce, generate a scaffold for an entity named "Todo." The default output for the "Show" link is malformed and generates a syntax error ("unexpected tIVAR, expecting keyword_do or '{' or '('").

BLOCK_EXPR probably just needs word boundaries or whitespace around the "do."

If necessary, this mailing list thread has additional info:

http://groups.google.com/group/rubyonrails-talk/browse_thread/threa...

version.body: Please provide a failing test case and patch for this issue.
version.body-html: Please provide a failing test case and patch for this issue.
version.title: Erubis template parsing error on invalid match for variable name containing "do"

version.body: Verified on master. When I generate a scaffold called todo, start the server and go to /todos, it throws a SyntaxError: @@@ compile error /Users/jeff/rails/tada/app/views/todos/index.html.erb:16: syntax error, unexpected tIVAR, expecting kDO or '{' or '(' ...to 'Show', todo @output_buffer.safe_concat(' ^ @@@ Here's the [Framework Trace](http://gist.github.com/402461).
version.body-html:
Verified on master. When I generate a scaffold called todo, start the server and go to /todos, it throws a SyntaxError:

compile error
/Users/jeff/rails/tada/app/views/todos/index.html.erb:16: syntax error, unexpected tIVAR, expecting kDO or '{' or '('
...to 'Show', todo @output_buffer.safe_concat('</td>
                              ^

Here's the Framework Trace.
version.title: Erubis template parsing error on invalid match for variable name containing "do"

version.body:
I've attached a patch
It doesn't have any tests at the moment - hoping to enlist some help on that front...
version.body-html:
I've attached a patch

It doesn't have any tests at the moment - hoping to enlist some help on that front...

version.body: +1 applies cleanly to master, tests pass. Scaffold generated Todo views no longer throw errors on 'show' links.

version.body:
(from [f58bdae1f716c71202546c5a40a951b5fc54a591]) Check blocks are not incorrectly detected when compiling erubis templates [#4575 state:resolved]
Signed-off-by: José Valim <jose.valim@gmail.com> http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/f58bdae1f716c71202546c5a40a951b5fc54a591
version.body-html:
